author: brandon-arnold
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

Even `help` will cause a Segmentation Fault, if I run it a few times. Below is the output when I open powershell and run `update-help -Debug`. It will eventually Segmentation Fault after a few prompts:

```powershell
$ sudo pwsh
PowerShell v6.0.0-rc
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS /home/brandon/Downloads> update-help -Debug
DEBUG: Found engine module: Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility, 1da87e53-152b-403e-98dc-74d7b4d63d59.

Confirm
Continue with this operation?
[Y] Yes  [A] Yes to All  [H] Halt Command  [S] Suspend  [?] Help (default is "Y"):
DEBUG: Found engine module: Microsoft.PowerShell.Host, 56d66100-99a0-4ffc-a12d-eee9a6718aef.

Confirm
Continue with this operation?
[Y] Yes  [A] Yes to All  [H] Halt Command  [S] Suspend  [?] Help (default is "Y"):
DEBUG: Found engine module: Microsoft.PowerShell.Management, eefcb906-b326-4e99-9f54-8b4bb6ef3c6d.

Confirm
Continue with this operation?
[Y] Yes  [A] Yes to All  [H] Halt Command  [S] Suspend  [?] Help (default is "Y"):
DEBUG: Found engine module: Microsoft.PowerShell.Security, a94c8c7e-9810-47c0-b8af-65089c13a35a.

Confirm
Continue with this operation?
[Y] Yes  [A] Yes to All  [H] Halt Command  [S] Suspend  [?] Help (default is "Y"):
DEBUG: Found engine module: Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility, 1da87e53-152b-403e-98dc-74d7b4d63d59.

Confirm
Continue with this operation?
[Y] Yes  [A] Yes to All  [H] Halt Command  [S] Suspend  [?] Help (default is "Y"):
Segmentation fault
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
`update-help` updates the help database.

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Segmentation Fault
```

Environment data
----------------
Debian 9 amd64

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-rc
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-rc
OS                             Linux 4.9.0-4-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.51-1 (2017-09-28)
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: domokr
comments.body:
Hello I had the same problem.
Solution:
Download the "**powershell-6.0.0-rc-linux-x64.tar.gz**" file and unzip it.
In this folder I changed the softlinks, because they were wrong:

```
lrwxrwxrwx  1 root   root                   41 2017-11-30 14:59 
libssl.so.1.0.0 -> /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libssl.so.1.0.2

lrwxrwxrwx  1 root   root                   44 2017-11-30 14:57 
libcrypto.so.1.0.0 -> /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcrypto.so.1.0.0
```
You can may change the versions of libssl.so and libcrypto.so but for me it works.
Last of all set the enviroment variable 
`export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/path/to/download/"` 

Hope i can help you.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: /cc @daxian-dbw

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: /cc @TravisEz13

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
There are actually 2 issues:
1. The segment fault of the Debian 9 package
2. The binary archive `tar.gz` package shouldn't contain those 2 symbolic link files. Those 2 files are created only for Red Hat family distros for Linux psrp-over-omi remoting, which only get created when powershell is built on a Red Hat family distro. We create the `tar.gz` package on CentOS 7, and that's why those 2 files are included.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
I've installed the package on debian 9 and I cannot reproduce the issue.  Can you run the following script and send me the CSV (which lists the packages, with the version you have installed) it generates:
```powershell
$uri = 'https://gist.githubusercontent.com/TravisEz13/683281edd952171efcf40b32674d875d/raw/510477553aaa0e1f0d412d04b4d51a768c457b85/GetDebianPackages.ps1'   
iex (Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $uri)                                                        
```
You can review the script here.  If you click the button to see the raw script, you should get the same URL (unless I've updated it.)

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
A couple of other things:

1. Are you using the default terminal, if not which terminal?
1. Can you try the repro with this set `$ProgressPreference = 'silentlycontinue'`

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Is `Update-Help -Debug` part of the repro or additional details?

comments.author: brandon-arnold
comments.body:
@TravisEz13 

Thanks for the help, my friend. The example of `Update-Help -Debug` was arbitrary. Most commands are giving me a `Segmentation Fault`. Sorry I didn't make that more clear. For example, here is me trying to type a simple `Get-ChildItem -Force -Recurse`:

```
PS /home/brandon/lp> Get-ChildItem -Force -RecSegmentation fault
```

That is, I was in the middle of typing `-Recurse` when powershell crashed.

Here is a session I just started `pwsh` and let it sit for about a minute. It eventually did give a segmentation fault without even having typed anything:

```
$ pwsh
PowerShell v6.0.0-rc
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS > Segmentation fault
```

Likewise with the lines you listed above (whether or not I start `pwsh` as root, viz:

```
PS /> $uri = 'https://gist.githubusercontent.com/TravisEz13/683281edd952171efcf40b32674d875d/raw/510477553aaa0e1f0d412d04b4d51a768c457b85/GetDebianPackages.ps1'
PS /> iex (Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $uri)
Segmentation fault
```

On the other hand, I downloaded the script and pasted it inito the terminal, and it worked. I have emailed you the CSV in question.

> Are you using the default terminal, if not which terminal?

`pwsh` is not set as my default terminal. Bash is my default terminal, and I am running `pwsh` from within it. The terminal emulator is urxvt.

> Can you try the repro with this set $ProgressPreference = 'silentlycontinue'

Yes, there is no difference in behavior after setting it as such. Still `Segmentation Fault`.

Hope that helps, a little!

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
I repro'ed the problem by running the following steps on my system:

```
echo 'deb http://ftp.de.debian.org/debian/ jessie main' | tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list
apt-get update
apt-get install libicu52 libssl1.0.0
```

I suspect this is a bug in dotnet in their portable module code with libraries from multiple distributions are present.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
We might want to consider creating a way for a customer to create a crash dump with `createdump`.  https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/master/Documentation/botr/xplat-minidump-generation.md#linux 

It's located in the following package `runtime.linux-x64.microsoft.netcore.app`

comments.author: MSAdministrator
comments.body:
Today I have ran into this issue on my Mac OS X but trying to use the `Find-Module` CmdLet.  I am running Mac OS X High Sierra (10.13.1) and running the latest release of PowerShell Core:

```
Name                           Value                                           
----                           -----                                           
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                     
PSEdition                      Core                                            
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                         
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                         
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.18                                 
CLRVersion                                                                     
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                             
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                             
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1 
```

To reproduce this, please do the following:
```
Find-Module *                                           
Segmentation fault: 11
```

I have made sure that I have the latest version installed using both `brew` and downloading the `.pkg` directly from the PowerShell repository.  Still having the same issues.

Anyone else experiencing this?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @TravisEz13 I see "The OS X support currently has not been implemented." on your link.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @MSAdministrator The latest release of PowerShell Core is `v6.0.0-rc`. The `alpha.18` release was at least half year ago. Can you try the `rc` release?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @brandon-arnold I moved this to 6.1.  Can you verify that if you remove these modules (`libicu52 libssl1.0.0`) or run on a system without these modules that the issue does not repro?

comments.author: brandon-arnold
comments.body: @TravisEz13 Yes, I can confirm that removing those modules fixed the issue. Good work! I'm going to install the modules back, though, as I'm not sure what depends on them.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @brandon-arnold This is likely a CoreFx/CoreClr issue.  It would be good if you got a crash dump per  https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/master/Documentation/botr/xplat-minidump-generation.md#linux and filed an issue.  Please link the issue here.  Mention the issue is resolved if you remove the libraries.  The simplest repro I found was running `h` repeatedly.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
@feitingen can you please provide `$psversiontable`?

Can you see if you have multiple versions of the packages mentioned in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5574#issuecomment-348734648 installed?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Please verify this issue is cause by https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5574#issuecomment-348734648 (multiple versions of libicu and libssl installed.) if it is not, please file a new issue.

comments.author: blex2
comments.body:
I had the same problem after upgrading from debian 8 to 9.
After removing the powershell package I saw there was a conflict on the libicu libssl and some other. 

Solution: apt-get remove powershell and then following 
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/installation/linux.md#debian-9

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @TravisEz13 Make sense add some pre-requested checks in PowerShell Core installer for better UX?

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @iSazonov  assuming it's possible, yes

comments.author: hook-s3c
comments.body: Months later still not resolved.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
@hook-s3c If you are having an issue, please report it.  The solution to this issue has been given in this comment: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5574#issuecomment-349478465

I'm closing this issue to encourage people to give complete issues reports that we can investigate.

comments.author: hook-s3c
comments.body: Ok, my bad - this is for Ubuntu, so I can't use these sources

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
The overall issue is DotNet does not (maybe did not, I haven't tried this in PowerShell 6.1) react well to having multiple version of the same library packages installed.  check the packages we depend on and see if multiple versions are installed, if there are, remove the one we don't need and see if it resolves the issue.  Also theoretically, the snap package should resolve this issue, but I have not tested that theory.

Also, please file a new issue with your repro.   Include what distro, what you do to cause the seg fault.  If you do find a workaround, please include that information.

title: Segmentation Fault due to mulitple version of libicu and libssl installed.
